title: unbelief
comment: The lack of faith and trust in God that challenges his truthfulness and finds expression in disobedience and rebellion.

children.title: unbelief, nature and effects of
children.comment: Unbelief, or the failure to trust God, holds back his blessing and leads to condemnation and spiritual death.

children.title: Unbelief as the result of the devil's work
Unbelief as the result of not belonging to God

primaryrefs.comment: The ``rest'' that God's people enjoyed on entering the promised land is here taken to symbolise the final reward prepared by God for his people.

children.title: Exclusion from the people of God
unbelief, as response to God
children.comment: The stubborn and sinful refusal to accept God's word and his messengers. Since the coming of Jesus Christ it is frequently expressed in the rejection of his person and teaching.

children.title: Rejection by those close to him

secondaryrefs.comment: Sennacherib of Assyria urges the inhabitants of Jerusalem to disbelieve Hezekiah's words
the evidence of Jesus Christ's miracles
the behaviour of a believing spouse

children.title: unbelief, and life of faith
children.comment: Believers may go through periods of doubt and indecision, especially on account of difficulties in trusting God or accepting certain aspects of his will for them.

children.title: General examples of unbelief in believers
The unbelief of Jesus Christ's disciples
Unbelief concerning Jesus Christ's power over the natural world
Unbelief concerning Jesus Christ's power to heal
